head.supplied: Department of Mines, ¶ Melbourne ¶ , ¶ 20th-10- ¶ 189 ¶ 4 ¶ Memorandum. ¶ Dear Baron von Mueller ¶ ¶ One of the trainees of the Geol survey — Mr Geo Foster now engaged in the "whipsticks" north of B...

div.p: RB MSS M1, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: One of the trainees of the Geol survey — Mr Geo Foster now engaged in the "whipsticks" north of Bendigo — is collecting the native plants of the locality This young man is a son of the present minister of Mines Hon Hy Foster MP and I want to encourage him in Botanical studies Would you kindly name the plants for him from time to time & oblige

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
James Stirling
MS accompanied by unrelated notes by Stirling (the second here is inside an empty specimen sheet): 'on wooded moist slopes of Mt Koscuisko western aspect — 6000 feet elevation | […] | 3.1.84'; and '— Shrub 7 feet high — | Habitat : Junction of Livingstone Ck & Mitta Mitta river on river banks. Alluvium — Alt. 1600 feet. | J Stirling 1-11-80'. The herbarium folder is marked on the front in an unknown hand: 'Flora of Australian Alps | Phanerogamea | No 248' and contains a typed label: 'Westringia sp. aff. eremicola Benth. var. quaterna Benth. | James Stirling'.
